item.title: Morgrave Miscellany and Lingering Soul
item.content:encoded:
While Im still sorta near completing the work for Exploring Ebberon homebrew races (Though my works been slowed due to a combination of my main computer kicking the bucket and being piled with exams), I've in the mean time happened to stumble upon two more lists of work by agreed upon homebrew authors:

Morgrave Miscellany - Keith Backer
This book is a supplement to Wayfinders Guide to Ebberon, and in terms of player resources, contains a number of subclasses, listed as follows:

- Barbarian: Path of the Extreme Explorer
- Bard: College of Keys
- Cleric: Sovereign Domain
- Druid: Circle of the Arbiter
- Fighter: Bone Knight
- Fighter: Vigilante
- Monk: Argent Fist
- Paladin: Oath of Sacrament
- Ranger: Field Marshal
- Rogue: Divine Herald
- Sorcerer: Progenitor Spark
- Warlock: Pact of the Host
- Wizard: School of Antiquities

I haven't yet gotten access to the book itself, but some of the archetypes from what I've been able to find have been pretty neat.

Lingering Soul - Matthew Mercer
The lingeing soul is a class / alterante death rule that allows a player to play a ghost. Again, havent read the content absolutely fully yet, but I think the idea is quite neat, and I would think it could be cool on the wikidot. However, I do believe it should, if on there, have notes about "Hey, you've gotta properly discuss this with a DM and all, this is homebrew and is also not designed for every game", because new players do use the site and etc. But aside from that, I think its pretty cool

So yeah, thoughts on these sets of homebrew? I presume morgrave is a pretty straightforward include, though lingering soul im not sure? If we did include lingering soul, I think itd be better to have it in the homebrew section and not give it the bloodhunter treatment where it gets top of the page (which bloodhunter gets due to its overwhelming popularity and mainstream-ness).

Yeah, just wanted to bring up things I found.
